documenttitle.text: Red Hat Bug Fix Advisory: Container Image Rebuild for Ansible Tower 3.4 Dependency

note.text: Container Image Rebuild for Ansible Tower 3.4 Dependency
note.title: Topic

note.text:
The ansible-tower-memcached container image has been updated for Red Hat Ansible Tower 3.4 for RHEL 7 to address security advisories:

RHSA-2019:2030
RHSA-2019:2118
RHSA-2019:2136
RHSA-2019:2197
RHSA-2019:2237
RHSA-2019:2304
RHSA-2019:4190
RHSA-2020:0227
note.title: Details

note.text: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, the getaddrinfo function would successfully parse a string that contained an IPv4 address followed by whitespace and arbitrary characters, which could lead applications to incorrectly assume that it had parsed a valid string, without the possibility of embedded HTTP headers or other potentially dangerous substrings.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1347549: CVE-2016-10739 glibc: getaddrinfo should reject IP addresses with trailing characters

note.text: Libgcrypt before 1.7.10 and 1.8.x before 1.8.3 allows a memory-cache side-channel attack on ECDSA signatures that can be mitigated through the use of blinding during the signing process in the _gcry_ecc_ecdsa_sign function in cipher/ecc-ecdsa.c, aka the Return Of the Hidden Number Problem or ROHNP. To discover an ECDSA key, the attacker needs access to either the local machine or a different virtual machine on the same physical host.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1591163: Key Extraction Side Channel in Multiple Crypto Libraries

note.text: The OpenSSL DSA signature algorithm has been shown to be vulnerable to a timing side channel attack. An attacker could use variations in the signing algorithm to recover the private key. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1a (Affected 1.1.1). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.0j (Affected 1.1.0-1.1.0i). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2q (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2p).
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1644364: CVE-2018-0734 openssl: timing side channel attack in the DSA signature algorithm

note.text: If the HOME environment variable is unset or empty, top will read its configuration file from the current working directory without any security check. If a user runs top with HOME unset in an attacker-controlled directory, the attacker could achieve privilege escalation by exploiting one of several vulnerabilities in the config_file() function.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1575466: CVE-2018-1122 procps-ng, procps: Local privilege escalation in top

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Qualys Research Labs for reporting this issue.

note.text: An error within the "parse_rollei()" function (internal/dcraw_common.cpp) within LibRaw versions prior to 0.19.1 can be exploited to trigger an infinite loop.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1661608: CVE-2018-5818 LibRaw: DoS in parse_rollei function in internal/dcraw_common.cpp

note.text: An error within the "parse_sinar_ia()" function (internal/dcraw_common.cpp) within LibRaw versions prior to 0.19.1 can be exploited to exhaust available CPU resources.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1661604: CVE-2018-5819 LibRaw: DoS in parse_sinar_ia function in internal/dcraw_common.cpp

note.text: A cached side channel attack during handshakes using RSA encryption could allow for the decryption of encrypted content. This is a variant of the Adaptive Chosen Ciphertext attack (AKA Bleichenbacher attack) and affects all NSS versions prior to NSS 3.41.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1657913: CVE-2018-12404 nss: Cache side-channel variant of the Bleichenbacher attack

note.text: An issue was discovered in arm_pt in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30. Stack Exhaustion occurs in the C++ demangling functions provided by libiberty, and there are recursive stack frames: demangle_arm_hp_template, demangle_class_name, demangle_fund_type, do_type, do_arg, demangle_args, and demangle_nested_args. This can occur during execution of nm-new.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1594410: CVE-2018-12641 binutils: Stack Exhaustion in the demangling functions provided by libiberty

note.text: A NULL pointer dereference (aka SEGV on unknown address 0x000000000000) was discovered in work_stuff_copy_to_from in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30. This can occur during execution of objdump.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1595417: CVE-2018-12697 binutils: NULL pointer dereference in work_stuff_copy_to_from in cplus-dem.c.

note.text: curl before version 7.61.1 is vulnerable to a buffer overrun in the NTLM authentication code. The internal function Curl_ntlm_core_mk_nt_hash multiplies the length of the password by two (SUM) to figure out how large temporary storage area to allocate from the heap. The length value is then subsequently used to iterate over the password and generate output into the allocated storage buffer. On systems with a 32 bit size_t, the math to calculate SUM triggers an integer overflow when the password length exceeds 2GB (2^31 bytes). This integer overflow usually causes a very small buffer to actually get allocated instead of the intended very huge one, making the use of that buffer end up in a heap buffer overflow. (This bug is almost identical to CVE-2017-8816.)
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1622707: CVE-2018-14618 curl: NTLM password overflow via integer overflow

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank the Curl project for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Zhaoyang Wu as the original reporter.

note.text: Python's elementtree C accelerator failed to initialise Expat's hash salt during initialization. This could make it easy to conduct denial of service attacks against Expat by contructing an XML document that would cause pathological hash collisions in Expat's internal data structures, consuming large amounts CPU and RAM.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1631822: CVE-2018-14647 python: Missing salt initialization in _elementtree.c module

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank the Python Security Response Team for reporting this issue.

note.text: It was discovered that systemd is vulnerable to a state injection attack when deserializing the state of a service. Properties longer than LINE_MAX are not correctly parsed and an attacker may abuse this flaw in particularly configured services to inject, change, or corrupt the service state.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1639071: line splitting via fgets() allows for state injection during daemon-reexec

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Jann Horn (Google Project Zero) and Ubuntu for reporting this issue.

note.text: An out-of-bounds read was discovered in elfutils in the way it reads DWARF address ranges information. Function dwarf_getaranges() in dwarf_getaranges.c does not properly check whether it reads beyond the limits of the ELF section. An attacker could use this flaw to cause a denial of service via a crafted file.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1623752: CVE-2018-16062 elfutils: Heap-based buffer over-read in libdw/dwarf_getaranges.c:dwarf_getaranges() via crafted file

note.text: libelf/elf_end.c in elfutils 0.173 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (double free and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact because it tries to decompress twice.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1625050: CVE-2018-16402 elfutils: Double-free due to double decompression of sections in crafted ELF causes crash

note.text: libdw in elfutils 0.173 checks the end of the attributes list incorrectly in dwarf_getabbrev in dwarf_getabbrev.c and dwarf_hasattr in dwarf_hasattr.c, leading to a heap-based buffer over-read and an application crash.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1625055: CVE-2018-16403 elfutils: Heap-based buffer over-read in libdw/dwarf_getabbrev.c and libwd/dwarf_hasattr.c causes crash

note.text: Curl versions 7.14.1 through 7.61.1 are vulnerable to a heap-based buffer over-read in the tool_msgs.c:voutf() function that may result in information exposure and denial of service.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1644124: CVE-2018-16842 curl: Heap-based buffer over-read in the curl tool warning formatting

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank the Curl project for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Brian Carpenter (Geeknik Labs) as the original reporter.

note.text: An out of bounds read was discovered in systemd-journald in the way it parses log messages that terminate with a colon ':'. A local attacker can use this flaw to disclose process memory data.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1653867: out-of-bounds read when parsing a crafted syslog message

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Qualys Research Labs for reporting this issue.

note.text: It was discovered systemd does not correctly check the content of PIDFile files before using it to kill processes. When a service is run from an unprivileged user (e.g. User field set in the service file), a local attacker who is able to write to the PIDFile of the mentioned service may use this flaw to trick systemd into killing other services and/or privileged processes.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1662867: CVE-2018-16888 systemd: kills privileged process if unprivileged PIDFile was tampered

note.text: An invalid memory address dereference was discovered in dwfl_segment_report_module.c in libdwfl in elfutils through v0.174. The vulnerability allows attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) with a crafted ELF file, as demonstrated by consider_notes.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1642604: CVE-2018-18310 elfutils: invalid memory address dereference was discovered in dwfl_segment_report_module.c in libdwfl

note.text: An Invalid Memory Address Dereference exists in the function elf_end in libelf in elfutils through v0.174. Although eu-size is intended to support ar files inside ar files, handle_ar in size.c closes the outer ar file before handling all inner entries. The vulnerability allows attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) with a crafted ELF file.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1646477: CVE-2018-18520 elfutils: eu-size cannot handle recursive ar files

note.text: Divide-by-zero vulnerabilities in the function arlib_add_symbols() in arlib.c in elfutils 0.174 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) with a crafted ELF file, as demonstrated by eu-ranlib, because a zero sh_entsize is mishandled.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1646482: CVE-2018-18521 elfutils: Divide-by-zero in arlib_add_symbols function in arlib.c

note.text: A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1665296: Reachable assertion in the KDC using S4U2Self requests

note.text: binutils version 2.32 and earlier contains a Integer Overflow vulnerability in objdump, bfd_get_dynamic_reloc_upper_bound,bfd_canonicalize_dynamic_reloc that can result in Integer overflow trigger heap overflow. Successful exploitation allows execution of arbitrary code.. This attack appear to be exploitable via Local. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in after commit 3a551c7a1b80fca579461774860574eabfd7f18f.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1664699: integer overflow leads to heap-based buffer overflow in objdump

note.text: If an application encounters a fatal protocol error and then calls SSL_shutdown() twice (once to send a close_notify, and once to receive one) then OpenSSL can respond differently to the calling application if a 0 byte record is received with invalid padding compared to if a 0 byte record is received with an invalid MAC. If the application then behaves differently based on that in a way that is detectable to the remote peer, then this amounts to a padding oracle that could be used to decrypt data. In order for this to be exploitable "non-stitched" ciphersuites must be in use. Stitched ciphersuites are optimised implementations of certain commonly used ciphersuites. Also the application must call SSL_shutdown() twice even if a protocol error has occurred (applications should not do this but some do anyway). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2r (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2q).
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

note.text: An out of bounds read flaw was discovered in libssh2 when a specially crafted SFTP packet is received from the server. A remote attacker who compromises a SSH server may be able to cause a denial of service or read data in the client memory.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1687306: Zero-byte allocation with a specially crafted SFTP packed leading to an out-of-bounds read

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank the libssh2 project for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Chris Coulson (Canonical Ltd.) as the original reporter.

note.text: An out of bounds read flaw was discovered in libssh2 in the way SSH packets with a padding length value greater than the packet length are parsed. A remote attacker who compromises a SSH server may be able to cause a denial of service or read data in the client memory.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1687311: Out-of-bounds reads with specially crafted SSH packets

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank the libssh2 project for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Chris Coulson (Canonical Ltd.) as the original reporter.

note.text: An out of bounds read flaw was discovered in libssh2 in the way SSH_MSG_CHANNEL_REQUEST packets with an exit status message and no payload are parsed. A remote attacker who compromises a SSH server may be able to cause a denial of service or read data in the client memory.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1687312: Out-of-bounds memory comparison with specially crafted message channel request

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank the libssh2 project for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Chris Coulson (Canonical Ltd.) as the original reporter.

note.text: A null pointer dereference vulnerability was found in the certificate parsing code in Python. This causes a denial of service to applications when parsing specially crafted certificates. This vulnerability is unlikely to be triggered if application enables SSL/TLS certificate validation and accepts certificates only from trusted root certificate authorities.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1666519: CVE-2019-5010 python: NULL pointer dereference using a specially crafted X509 certificate

note.text: A heap-based buffer over-read was discovered in the function read_srclines in dwarf_getsrclines.c in libdw in elfutils 0.175. A crafted input can cause segmentation faults, leading to denial-of-service, as demonstrated by eu-nm.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1671443: CVE-2019-7149 elfutils: heap-based buffer over-read in read_srclines in dwarf_getsrclines.c in libdw

note.text: An issue was discovered in elfutils 0.175. A segmentation fault can occur in the function elf64_xlatetom in libelf/elf32_xlatetom.c, due to dwfl_segment_report_module not checking whether the dyn data read from a core file is truncated. A crafted input can cause a program crash, leading to denial-of-service, as demonstrated by eu-stack.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1671446: CVE-2019-7150 elfutils: segmentation fault in elf64_xlatetom in libelf/elf32_xlatetom.c

note.text: In elfutils 0.175, a negative-sized memcpy is attempted in elf_cvt_note in libelf/note_xlate.h because of an incorrect overflow check. Crafted elf input causes a segmentation fault, leading to denial of service (program crash).
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1677536: CVE-2019-7664 elfutils: out of bound write in elf_cvt_note in libelf/note_xlate.h

note.text: In elfutils 0.175, a heap-based buffer over-read was discovered in the function elf32_xlatetom in elf32_xlatetom.c in libelf. A crafted ELF input can cause a segmentation fault leading to denial of service (program crash) because ebl_core_note does not reject malformed core file notes.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1677538: CVE-2019-7665 elfutils: heap-based buffer over-read in function elf32_xlatetom in elf32_xlatetom.c

note.text: An issue was discovered in urllib2 in Python 2.x through 2.7.16 and urllib in Python 3.x through 3.7.3. CRLF injection is possible if the attacker controls a url parameter, as demonstrated by the first argument to urllib.request.urlopen with \r\n (specifically in the query string after a ? character) followed by an HTTP header or a Redis command. This is fixed in: v2.7.17, v2.7.17rc1, v2.7.18, v2.7.18rc1; v3.5.10, v3.5.10rc1, v3.5.8, v3.5.8rc1, v3.5.8rc2, v3.5.9; v3.6.10, v3.6.10rc1, v3.6.11, v3.6.11rc1, v3.6.12, v3.6.9, v3.6.9rc1; v3.7.4, v3.7.4rc1, v3.7.4rc2, v3.7.5, v3.7.5rc1, v3.7.6, v3.7.6rc1, v3.7.7, v3.7.7rc1, v3.7.8, v3.7.8rc1, v3.7.9.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1688169: CVE-2019-9740 python: CRLF injection via the query part of the url passed to urlopen()

note.text: An issue was discovered in urllib2 in Python 2.x through 2.7.16 and urllib in Python 3.x through 3.7.3. CRLF injection is possible if the attacker controls a url parameter, as demonstrated by the first argument to urllib.request.urlopen with \r\n (specifically in the path component of a URL that lacks a ? character) followed by an HTTP header or a Redis command. This is similar to the CVE-2019-9740 query string issue. This is fixed in: v2.7.17, v2.7.17rc1, v2.7.18, v2.7.18rc1; v3.5.10, v3.5.10rc1, v3.5.8, v3.5.8rc1, v3.5.8rc2, v3.5.9; v3.6.10, v3.6.10rc1, v3.6.11, v3.6.11rc1, v3.6.12, v3.6.9, v3.6.9rc1; v3.7.4, v3.7.4rc1, v3.7.4rc2, v3.7.5, v3.7.5rc1, v3.7.6, v3.7.6rc1, v3.7.7, v3.7.7rc1, v3.7.8, v3.7.8rc1, v3.7.9.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1695572: CVE-2019-9947 python: CRLF injection via the path part of the url passed to urlopen()

note.text: urllib in Python 2.x through 2.7.16 supports the local_file: scheme, which makes it easier for remote attackers to bypass protection mechanisms that blacklist file: URIs, as demonstrated by triggering a urllib.urlopen('local_file:///etc/passwd') call.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1695570: CVE-2019-9948 python: Undocumented local_file protocol allows remote attackers to bypass protection mechanisms

note.text: Empty or malformed p256-ECDH public keys may trigger a segmentation fault due values being improperly sanitized before being copied into memory and used. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.8, Firefox < 68, and Thunderbird < 60.8.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1728437: CVE-2019-11729 nss: Empty or malformed p256-ECDH public keys may trigger a segmentation fault

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank the Mozilla project for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Jonas Allmann as the original reporter.

note.text: A heap-based buffer overflow was found in the NSC_EncryptUpdate() function in Mozilla nss. A remote attacker could trigger this flaw via SRTP encrypt or decrypt operations, to execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running the application (compiled with nss). While the attack complexity is high, the impact to confidentiality, integrity, and availability are high as well.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1774831: CVE-2019-11745 nss: Out-of-bounds write when passing an output buffer smaller than the block size to NSC_EncryptUpdate

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank the Mozilla Project for reporting this issue.

note.text: Out of bounds write in SQLite in Google Chrome prior to 79.0.3945.79 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1781980: CVE-2019-13734 sqlite: fts3: improve shadow table corruption detection

note.text: A flaw was found in the pipe lookup plugin of ansible. Arbitrary commands can be run, when the pipe lookup plugin uses subprocess.Popen() with shell=True, by overwriting ansible facts and the variable is not escaped by quote plugin. An attacker could take advantage and run arbitrary commands by overwriting the ansible facts.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1801804: CVE-2020-1734 ansible: shell enabled by default in a pipe lookup plugin subprocess

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Damien Aumaitre (Quarkslab) and Nicolas Surbayrole (Quarkslab) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A flaw was found in the Ansible Engine when the fetch module is used. An attacker could intercept the module, inject a new path, and then choose a new destination path on the controller node.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1802085: CVE-2020-1735 ansible: path injection on dest parameter in fetch module

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Damien Aumaitre (Quarkslab) and Nicolas Surbayrole (Quarkslab) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A flaw was found in Ansible Engine when a file is moved using atomic_move primitive as the file mode cannot be specified. This sets the destination files world-readable if the destination file does not exist and if the file exists, the file could be changed to have less restrictive permissions before the move.  This issue affects only the newly created files and not existing ones. If the file already exists at the final destination, those permissions are retained. This could lead to the disclosure of sensitive data.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1802124: CVE-2020-1736 ansible: atomic_move primitive sets permissive permissions

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Damien Aumaitre (Quarkslab) and Nicolas Surbayrole (Quarkslab) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A flaw was found in the Ansible Engine when using the Extract-Zip function from the win_unzip module as the extracted file(s) are not checked if they belong to the destination folder. An attacker could take advantage of this flaw by crafting an archive anywhere in the file system, using a path traversal.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1802154: CVE-2020-1737 ansible: Extract-Zip function in win_unzip module does not check extracted path

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Damien Aumaitre (Quarkslab) and Nicolas Surbayrole (Quarkslab) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A flaw was found in Ansible Engine when the module package or service is used and the parameter 'use' is not specified. If a previous task is executed with a malicious user, the module sent can be selected by the attacker using the ansible facts file.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1802164: CVE-2020-1738 ansible: module package can be selected by the ansible facts

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Damien Aumaitre (Quarkslab) and Nicolas Surbayrole (Quarkslab) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A flaw was found in Ansible Engine. When a password is set with the argument "password" of svn module, it is used on svn command line, disclosing to other users within the same node. An attacker could take advantage by reading the cmdline file from that particular PID on the procfs.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1802178: CVE-2020-1739 ansible: svn module leaks password when specified as a parameter

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Damien Aumaitre (Quarkslab) and Nicolas Surbayrole (Quarkslab) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A flaw was found in Ansible Engine when using Ansible Vault for editing encrypted files. When a user executes "ansible-vault edit", another user on the same computer can read the old and new secret, as it is created in a temporary file with mkstemp and the returned file descriptor is closed and the method write_data is called to write the existing secret in the file. This method will delete the file before recreating it insecurely.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1802193: CVE-2020-1740 ansible: secrets readable after ansible-vault edit

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Damien Aumaitre (Quarkslab) and Nicolas Surbayrole (Quarkslab) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A flaw was found in the Ansible Engine when the ldap_attr and ldap_entry community modules are used. The issue discloses the LDAP bind password to stdout or a log file if a playbook task is written using the bind_pw in the parameters field. The highest threat from this vulnerability is data confidentiality.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1805491: CVE-2020-1746 ansible: Information disclosure issue in ldap_attr and ldap_entry modules

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Felix Fountein for reporting this issue.

note.text: A security flaw was found in the Ansible Engine when managing Kubernetes using the k8s connection plugin. Sensitive parameters such as passwords and tokens are passed to the kubectl command line instead of using environment variables or an input configuration file, which is safer. This flaw discloses passwords and tokens from the process list, and the no_log directive from the debug module would not be reflected in the underlying command-line tools options, displaying passwords and tokens on stdout and log files.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1811008: CVE-2020-1753 Ansible: kubectl connection plugin leaks sensitive information

acknowledgment.Description: This issue was discovered by Abhijeet Kasurde (Red Hat).

note.text: A flaw was found in the Ansible Engine. When using ansible_facts as a subkey of itself, and promoting it to a variable when injecting is enabled, overwriting the ansible_facts after the clean, an attacker could take advantage of this by altering the ansible_facts leading to privilege escalation or code injection. The highest threat from this vulnerability are to data integrity and system availability.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1815519: CVE-2020-10684 Ansible: code injection when using ansible_facts as a subkey

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Damien Aumaitre (Quarkslab) and Nicolas Surbayrole (Quarkslab) for reporting this issue.

note.text:
A flaw was found on Ansible Engine when using modules which decrypts vault files such as assemble, script, unarchive, win_copy, aws_s3 or copy modules.  The temporary directory is created in /tmp leaves the secrets unencrypted.

On Operating Systems which /tmp is not a tmpfs but part of the root partition, the directory is only cleared on boot and the decrypted data remains when the host is switched off. The system will be vulnerable when the system is not running. So decrypted data must be cleared as soon as possible and the data which normally is encrypted is sensible.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

reference.Description: bz#1814627: CVE-2020-10685 Ansible: modules which use files encrypted with vault are not properly cleaned up

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Damien Aumaitre (Quarkslab) and Nicolas Surbayrole (Quarkslab) for reporting this issue.
